reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Absolutely love this book
reviews.reviewText: I absolutely loved this book. I will forever recommend this book. It's sweet and witty. I LOVE Amelia and Noah! The banter is funny and adorable between them. I just love it!Grumpy x sunshinePretty clean rom com bookSmall town romanceBaker x burned out pop star

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Okay so cute. Grumpy x sunshine when Amelia’s car breakdown in the front of Noah’s house. She’s trying to escape her fame & he’s not looking for company. I really enjoyed this book!

reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Basic ROM com
reviews.reviewText: Cute and Light and spice but all the feelings.This was a quick read with lots of heart warming moments.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Cute Rom-Com read!
reviews.reviewText: If you are looking for a quick, fun and cute read. Sarah Adams is your girl. Not a lot spice, so if you a big fan of that, may wanna look somewhere else. But sometimes you just was sweet cozy reads. This is one of them!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Such a cute read!! 4 pancake stars!!!!
reviews.reviewText: My little romance-loving heart just loved this story!! All the stars for Amelia and Noah! I loved the playful banter, the angst, the side characters, the storyline, the real feelings that my heart went through with Noah and Amelia as I read this story! I also loved all of Amelia’s nicknames she came up with for Noah! This is my first Sarah Adams book but definitely won’t be my last!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Amelia is Rae Rose, pop star. She is finding she is not happy with her life, so she decides to take a vacation without telling anyone. Audrey Hepburn is her go-to movie star. She decides to go to Rome like Audrey did in Roman Holiday, but Italy is too far, so she goes to Rome, Kentucky. Her car breaks down on the outskirts of town. A man knocks on her window, but she will not unwind the window or get out of her car. He gets frustrated and walks back to his house where her car is parked on his front lawn. Noah, the man, decides it is too hot for her to stay in her car, so he asks Mabel, his grandmother's friend, to vouch for his good character. After talking to Mabel, Amelia gets out of the car and stays in Noah's extra room for the night, figuring she will get to the bed and breakfast in town the next morning. She finds it will take two weeks to fix her car, so Noah reluctantly offers his spare room. Both are attracted but know she will only temporarily be in town, so they make rules and build walls to keep from getting close. Will it work?I enjoyed this book. It was fun watching Amelia get under Noah's skin as she imitated him, discovered things about him, constantly chattering at him, and all the other little things she does. Noah's been burned by an ex-fiancée. He does not trust easily. Even knowing she's only temporarily in his life, he still falls for her. Amelia also falls for Noah. She has been spoiled living the pop star life and knows little of how to take care of herself. But with Noah, she knows she is safe. I liked watching them set up their rules and walls and seeing them fall. I liked the vulnerability each brings to their relationship. Amelia learns a lot about herself while in Rome. She starts to find the joy of music again as well as the comfort of safe people in her life. Noah also learns about himself while trying not to fall in love.I loved the town and its people. A bunch of gossips who have good hearts and protect those they see as theirs. I loved Noah's sisters. Each was different in personality, but each backed the others, The characters were quirky. They were fun. They saw love when it hit their town.I look forward to reading more of this author's work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was my first Sarah Adams book and I was really excited to read it after the hype that The Cheat Sheet receives. I was not disappointed. I could totally see this being made into a Hallmark Movie. The main characters, Amelia and Noah are the absolute cutest. I fell in love with them quickly. The writing in this book is well done. I caught myself smiling and giggling at the banter more than once.Amelia is a pop star that was so stressed out she ran away to hide before her tour. An absolute catastrophe of a day happens and she meets Noah, the grumpy Pie Shop owner in the extremely small town of Rome, Kentucky. Stuck in town for a bit, the town grows on Amelia. While I love the main characters, it was easy to love the side characters too. Annie was my favorite secondary character in the whole book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars city girl meets country boy
reviews.reviewText: I was laughing from the 1st page to the last page and it is true ... opposite do come together ... with some help of nosy folks in townworth reading
Written from the perspective of both characters, this book's humor and storyline keeps you reading more and more. I uust started reading the sequel.

Achei a história muito bacana, leve, divertida. Fala sobre momentos de vida em que nos estafamos e precisamos pausar. E como, com isso, aprendemos que descanso não é luxo, precisamos ouvir nosso corpo, nossa mente. Adorei como a história se desenvolveu e acho que vai ressoar com quem também já passou por traumas que deixaram marcas no presente.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: A sweet, poignant slow burn with a beautiful ending!
reviews.reviewText: Absolutely loved this! The original grumpy x sunshine. Amelia is a famous pop star who turns up at Noah's house after running away from her own life in Nashville. Forced to stay in his tiny town after her car breaks down she finds herself more at home than she thought....I loved the chemistry between Amelia and Noah and the rest of the characters were just as good! His sisters were awesome and I can't wait to trd more about them!If you like your romcoms with a side of pie, this is the one for you!

Me han encantado los personajes, como se retrata la ansiedad y lo tiernos que son ambos personajes. Es muy instalove, que no es el elemento más atractivo en una trama para mí, pero en este caso ha sido precioso.

Je ne pensais pas qu’en reprenant la lecture en anglais avec When in Rome, je le lirai en moins de 24h mais qu’en plus de ça c’est également un énorme coup de coeur. Pour la petite histoire, je voulais lire Pratice makes perfect, mais j’ai vue que c’était la suite de When In Rome et pour moi il était inconcevable que je ne le lise pas.Me voilà donc, à lire When in Rome sans avoir d’attente, sans quoi que se soit pour au final tombée sur un petit bonbon. C’est drôle, léger, doux, bienveillant. On rencontre deux personnages qui sont à l’opposé l’un de l’autre, lui ? Il tient un pie shop, elle ? Une super star de la musique. Deux mondes qui rentrent en collision. Le besoin d’Amelia de fuir se monde était si puissant qu’elle se retrouve à Rome, Kentucky.Pourquoi ? Parce qu’elle est fan d’Audrey Hepburn mais partir en Italie en voiture c’était compliquée. Elle se retrouve donc en panne, devant chez Noah Walker. Lui qui ne vit que pour sa famille, son commerce. Après une déception amoureuse il ne veut plus attendre parler de tout ça, mais c’était sans compter l’arrivée d’Amelia devant chez lui. J’ai accrochée très vite avec l’histoire, les personnages, puis disons le, la trope smalltown elle dégage quelque chose d’incroyable. Le sexe est mentionné, avec pudeur et parcimonie vous ne retrouvez pas de scène de smut, mais soyons franc : ça fait du bien. Bref, c’est un coup de coeur, j’ai adorée découvrir nos personnages et je vais lire la suite parce que… C’est la petite soeur de Noah, avec le garde du corps d’Amelia, (ceux qui me connaissent le savent : je suis en train de jubiler derrière mon écran en parlant de se prochain tome).
